summary: The Confronting CCP Human Rights Abusers Act (S. 1772) mandates the inclusion of the Ministry of Public Security’s Institute of Forensic Science of China on the entity list maintained by the Bureau of Industry and Security of the Department of Commerce. This action aims to restrict the institute's access to U.S. goods and technologies. The President can waive this requirement under specific conditions.  The Act focuses on addressing human rights abuses allegedly committed by the Chinese government, specifically targeting the repression of Uyghurs and other Muslim minorities.
